profile.bio:
American Public Health Association's 2024 Annual Meeting & Expo - Building Trust in Public Health and Science
Minneapolis | Oct. 27-30

tweets.tweetText:
We had a wonderful time at this week's 
@APHAAnnualMtg
 connecting with colleagues and sharing work related to rebuilding trust in #PublicHealth and Science. Already looking forward to next year!
#APHA2024

A panel discussion at #APHA2024 Tuesday highlighted the importance of including people who have intellectual and developmental disabilities in conversations and decisions about their health. http://publichealthnewswire.org/?p=disabilities__session_2024…

Food assistance programs, such as the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, exist to meet the nutritional needs of people with food insecurity. However, stigma surrounding these programs and their recipients is widespread. #APHA2024
http://publichealthnewswire.org/?p=food_assistance_2024…
Join us tomorrow! Attend the #APHA2024 session titled "Health and Wellbeing in a Climate-Changed World: Community-Engaged Approaches for Health Practitioners",  10:30am -12 pm @climatechangeshealth

WHO is impacted by occupational hazards? WHAT should we know to look out for? WHEN did our employers know we were at risk?  To get the answers come to the #OHS Invited Session Fighting back against disregard for worker’s lives #APHA2024 #WorkersRights
At the #APHA2024 Monday General Session, health leaders talked about the paradox of public health. http://publichealthnewswire.org/?p=invisible_shield_2024…

Join the Science Board and speakers Dr. Polina Durneva, Dr. Jason Wang and Dr. Jing Wu, this afternoon to explore the role of AI in public health, highlighting its innovations, challenges, and opportunities. Session 4283, today from 4:30-6 p.m. CT, in MCC Auditorium 1 #APHA2024
